main event: A brilliant bluish-white object about 30 to 50 feet in diameter with a tail or exhaust was sighted in Delray Beach, Florida on 2 February 1955. It moved rapidly and erratically through the sky before suddenly increasing in size, changing elevation, and then disappearing.
interesting points: The object was observed for about six minutes and approximately 30 seconds, disappeared, and then reappeared for the same duration before finally becoming invisible.
The surface visibility during the sighting was excellent, with clear and cool conditions.
The sighting was categorized as a ground-visual observation, and the length of the observation was about 30 seconds.
Photographs were taken during the sighting, and a report indicates that it was sent through channels for evaluation.
A Captain in the United States Marine Corps reported the sighting to intelligence officers, and the reliability of the report was considered very good.
sighted object: A brilliant bluish-white object about 30 to 50 feet in diameter with a tail or exhaust
witnesses: Reported by a Captain in the United States Marine Corps
photographs: Yes, photographs were taken during the sighting
